1: guild name (2-100 characters, excluding trailing and leading whitespace)
3: icon hash, returned when in the template object
5: discovery splash hash; only present for guilds with the "DISCOVERABLE" feature
6: true if the user is the owner of the guild
8: total permissions for the user in the guild (excludes overwrites)
9: voice region id for the guild (deprecated)
12: true if the server widget is enabled
13: the channel id that the widget will generate an invite to, or null if set to no invite
14: verification level required for the guild
20: required MFA level for the guild
21: application id of the guild creator if it is bot-created
22: the id of the channel where guild notices such as welcome messages and boost events are posted
24: the id of the channel where Community guilds can display rules and/or guidelines
25: the maximum number of presences for the guild (null is always returned, apart from the largest of guilds)
26: the maximum number of members for the guild
27: the vanity url code for the guild
31: the number of boosts this guild currently has
32: the preferred locale of a Community guild; used in server discovery and notices from Discord, and sent in interactions; defaults to "en-US"
33: the id of the channel where admins and moderators of Community guilds receive notices from Discord
34: the maximum amount of users in a video channel
35: the maximum amount of users in a stage video channel
36: approximate number of members in this guild, returned from the GET /guilds/<id> and /users/@me/guilds endpoints when with_counts is true
37: approximate number of non-offline members in this guild, returned from the GET /guilds/<id> and /users/@me/guilds  endpoints when with_counts is true
38: the welcome screen of a Community guild, shown to new members, returned in an Invite's guild object
41: whether the guild has the boost progress bar enabled
42: the id of the channel where admins and moderators of Community guilds receive safety alerts from Discord

0: members will receive notifications for all messages by default
1: members will receive notifications only for messages that @mention them by default

0: media content will not be scanned
1: media content sent by members without roles will be scanned
2: media content sent by all members will be scanned

0: guild has no MFA/2FA requirement for moderation actions
1: guild has a 2FA requirement for moderation actions
must have verified email on account
2: must be registered on Discord for longer than 5 minutes
3: must be a member of the server for longer than 10 minutes
4: must have a verified phone number

0: guild has not unlocked any Server Boost perks
1: guild has unlocked Server Boost level 1 perks
2: guild has unlocked Server Boost level 2 perks
3: guild has unlocked Server Boost level 3 perks
Hide member join sticker reply buttons
4: Suppress role subscription purchase and renewal notifications
5: Hide role subscription sticker reply buttons

0: guild has access to set an animated guild banner image
1: guild has access to set an animated guild icon
2: guild is using the old permissions configuration behavior
3: guild has set up auto moderation rules
4: guild has access to set a guild banner image
5: guild can enable welcome screen, Membership Screening, stage channels and discovery, and receives community updates
7: guild has enabled the role subscription promo page
8: guild has been set as a support server on the App Directory
9: guild is able to be discovered in the directory
10: guild is able to be featured in the directory
11: guild has paused invites, preventing new users from joining
12: guild has access to set an invite splash background
14: guild has increased custom sticker slots
15: guild has access to create announcement channels
17: guild can be previewed before joining via Membership Screening or the directory
18: guild has disabled alerts for join raids in the configured safety alerts channel
19: guild is able to set role icons
20: guild has role subscriptions that can be purchased
23: guild has access to set a vanity URL
25: guild has access to set 384kbps bitrate in voice (previously VIP voice servers)
26: guild has enabled the welcome screen

0: Enables Community Features in the guild
1: Enables discovery in the guild, making it publicly listed
2: Pauses all invites/access to the server

7: approximate number of members in this guild
8: approximate number of online members in this guild

2: instant invite for the guilds specified widget invite channel
3: voice and stage channels which are accessible by @everyone
4: special widget user objects that includes users presence (Limit 100)
5: number of online members in this guild

0: the user this guild member represents
4: when the user joined the guild
5: when the user started boosting the guild
6: whether the user is deafened in voice channels
7: whether the user is muted in voice channels
8: guild member flags represented as a bit set, defaults to 0
9: whether the user has not yet passed the guild's Membership Screening requirements
10: total permissions of the member in the channel, including overwrites, returned when in the interaction object
11: when the user's timeout will expire and the user will be able to communicate in the guild again, null or a time in the past if the user is not timed out

0: Member has left and rejoined the guild
2: Member is exempt from guild verification requirements
integration type (twitch, youtube, discord, or guild_subscription)
5: id that this integration uses for "subscribers"
6: whether emoticons should be synced for this integration (twitch only currently)
8: the grace period (in days) before expiring subscribers
11: when this integration was last synced
12: how many subscribers this integration has
14: The bot/OAuth2 application for discord integrations
15: the scopes the application has been authorized for

2: the icon hash of the app
4: the bot associated with this application

0: the server description shown in the welcome screen
1: array of welcome screen channel objects
the channels shown in the welcome screen, up to 5
the description shown for the channel
2: the emoji id, if the emoji is custom
3: the emoji name if custom, the unicode character if standard, or null if no emoji is set

0: ID of the guild this onboarding is part of
1: Prompts shown during onboarding and in customize community
2: Channel IDs that members get opted into automatically

4: Indicates whether users are limited to selecting one option for the prompt
5: Indicates whether the prompt is required before a user completes the onboarding flow
6: Indicates whether the prompt is present in the onboarding flow. If false, the prompt will only appear in the Channels & Roles tab

1: IDs for channels a member is added to when the option is selected
2: IDs for roles assigned to a member when the option is selected

0: Counts only Default Channels towards constraints
1: Counts Default Channels and Questions towards constraints

2: base64 128x128 image for the guild icon
9: afk timeout in seconds, can be set to: 60, 300, 900, 1800, 3600
10: the id of the channel where guild notices such as welcome messages and boost events are posted

0: when true, will return approximate member and presence counts for the guild

6: afk timeout in seconds, can be set to: 60, 300, 900, 1800, 3600
7: base64 1024x1024 png/jpeg/gif image for the guild icon (can be animated gif when the server has the ANIMATED_ICON feature)
8: user id to transfer guild ownership to (must be owner)
9: base64 16:9 png/jpeg image for the guild splash (when the server has the INVITE_SPLASH feature)
10: base64 16:9 png/jpeg image for the guild discovery splash (when the server has the DISCOVERABLE feature)
11: base64 16:9 png/jpeg image for the guild banner (when the server has the BANNER feature; can be animated gif when the server has the ANIMATED_BANNER feature)
12: the id of the channel where guild notices such as welcome messages and boost events are posted
14: the id of the channel where Community guilds display rules and/or guidelines
15: the id of the channel where admins and moderators of Community guilds receive notices from Discord
16: the preferred locale of a Community guild used in server discovery and notices from Discord; defaults to "en-US"
19: whether the guild's boost progress bar should be enabled
20: the id of the channel where admins and moderators of Community guilds receive safety alerts from Discord

3: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice or stage channel; min 8000
4: the user limit of the voice channel
5: amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected
8: id of the parent category for a channel
10: channel voice region id of the voice or stage channel, automatic when set to null
11: the camera video quality mode of the voice channel
12: the default duration that the clients use (not the API) for newly created threads in the channel, in minutes, to automatically archive the thread after recent activity
13: emoji to show in the add reaction button on a thread in a GUILD_FORUM channel
14: set of tags that can be used in a GUILD_FORUM channel
15: the default sort order type used to order posts in GUILD_FORUM channels
16: the default forum layout view used to display posts in GUILD_FORUM channels

1: a thread member object for each returned thread the current user has joined

0: max number of members to return (1-1000)
1: the highest user id in the previous page

0: Query string to match username(s) and nickname(s) against.
1: max number of members to return (1-1000)

0: an oauth2 access token granted with the guilds.join to the bot's application for the user you want to add to the guild
1: value to set user's nickname to

0: value to set user's nickname to

value to set user's nickname to
number of users to return (up to maximum 1000)

2: consider only users after given user id
